page.title: 04CROPS-PEAS & STRAWBERRIES
page.content: {PEAS}are grown on a large scale for quick freezing at{Grimsby}and are frozen within 90 minutes of being shelled. The varieties and sowing times are arranged so that, in theory, at least the crops ripen in succesion over an average of{42/45 day harvest. In order to preserve quality the harvest continues non-stop with two teams of men working the machines. The basic machine is the{podder which strips the pods from the plants, then threshes the peas out of the pods by a large rotating drum, cleans them by sieves and air blasts. On the land both east and west of Ermine street large acreage is put under{STRAWBERRY cultivation.}The main crop is sold to the public who pick their own and pay for it by weight. {This years price (1985) was 22p per {one pound weight of strawberres.
